H0.text: In Greek mythology which king of Corinth was compelled to eternally roll a large boulder up a hill only to watch it roll down again. Tantalus

H1.text: In Greek mythology which king of Corinth was compelled to eternally roll a large boulder up a hill only to watch it roll down again. Atlas

H2.text: In Greek mythology which king of Corinth was compelled to eternally roll a large boulder up a hill only to watch it roll down again. Prometheus

H3.text: In Greek mythology which king of Corinth was compelled to eternally roll a large boulder up a hill only to watch it roll down again. Siziph

A4.text: Sisyphus was the founder and king of Ephyra (now known as Corinth).

A5.text: The gods forced him to roll an immense boulder up a hill only for it to roll back down every time it neared the top, repeating this action for eternity.
